jsdoc.description: Fired when the header is transformed.
jsdoc.orig:
*
     * Fired when the header is transformed.
     *
     * @event paper-header-transform

events.name: paper-header-transform

properties.name: condensedHeaderHeight
properties.desc:
The height of the header when it is condensed.

By default, `condensedHeaderHeight` is 1/3 of `headerHeight` unless
this is specified.

properties.name: condenses
properties.desc:
If true, the header's height will condense to `condensedHeaderHeight`
as the user scrolls down from the top of the content area.

properties.name: content
properties.desc: Returns the content element.

properties.name: fixed
properties.desc: If true, the header is fixed to the top and never moves away.

properties.name: header
properties.desc: Returns the header element.

properties.name: headerHeight
properties.desc:
The height of the header when it is at its full size.

By default, the height will be measured when it is ready.  If the height
changes later the user needs to either set this value to reflect the
new height or invoke `measureHeaderHeight()`.

properties.name: keepCondensedHeader
properties.desc: If true, the condensed header is always shown and does not move away.

properties.name: measureHeaderHeight
properties.desc:
Invoke this to tell `paper-scroll-header-panel` to re-measure the header's
height.

properties.name: noDissolve
properties.desc: If true, no cross-fade transition from one background to another.

properties.name: noReveal
properties.desc: If true, the header doesn't slide back in when scrolling back up.

properties.name: scrollAwayTopbar
properties.desc:
By default, the top part of the header stays when the header is being
condensed.  Set this to true if you want the top part of the header
to be scrolled away.

properties.name: scroller
properties.desc: Returns the scrollable element.
